docs.lead_paragraph: THE greatest experiment in social service ever attempted by a democratic Government -- Britain's "cradle-to-grave" National Health Service -- has been in operation for six months. That is too short a time to pronounce it a success or a failure, but not too short to describe and assess its early life.

headline.main: Report on Britain's 'Cradle-to-Grave' Plan; Its first six months finds free medicine for all popular, despite controversies and high costs.
